data.event: In 1855, the first horse race took place at Ely Racecourse, which took over from the Great Heath racecourse.

It was very much a product of the Victorian age, and workhouse mentality, increased social awareness and responsibility saw it closing in 1903 and converted to additional workhouse accommodation for adults (though never used for that purpose), known as Ely Lodge.
The school was demolished some years later and an infectious diseases isolation unit was built on the same site.
